active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a small group, debate the statement: 'Personnel succession planning is more critical in cybersecurity than in other IT domains due to the high-stakes nature of threats.' Support your position with references to NIST frameworks and real-world breach examples (e.g., knowledge loss in incidents like SolarWinds). Identify two pros and two cons, then propose optimizations.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Personnel Succession Planning (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Business Continuity Planning > Plan Development and Documentation > Specialized Plan Components > Personnel Succession Planning). **Completed Research Context:** Succession planning identifies/develops successors for critical cybersecurity roles to mitigate risks like knowledge loss. Objectives: mitigate risk, ensure continuity, develop talent, enhance resilience, retention. Frameworks: NIST NICE (TKS → Competencies → 33 Work Roles in 7 Categories/52 Areas, e.g., Protect and Defend); NIST RMF (SP 800-37: integrates in Prepare/Categorize/Monitor to manage personnel risks as single points of failure); NIST SP 800-53 (PS controls); SP 800-34 (BCP). Best Practices (Layer 3): 1) ID roles w/NICE. 2) Assess gaps. 3) IDPs/training. 4) Timelines. 5) Monitor. Sources: NIST NICE (nist.gov/itl/applied-cybersecurity/nice); SP 800-37 (doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-37r2); SP 800-53 (nist.gov/800-53); SP 800-34 (csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/34/r1/final). **Pedagogy:** Align to these objectives [insert learning_objectives array]. Use 4 scaffolding layers [insert scaffolding_layers object]. Incorporate active learning hooks [insert active_learning object]. **Generate Flashcards:** Output 75 flashcards in JSON array: [{'front': '... (Bloom: LEVEL, Layer: #)', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'distractors': ['opt1', 'opt2', 'opt3'], 'hook': '...', 'source': '...' }}]. Follow schema [insert flashcard_schema object exactly]. Ensure measurable, active, progressive learning. Vary difficulty per Bloom's.
